official_narrative: The 1965 war with India was a result of conflict over the disputed territory of Kashmir.
key_points: Operation Gibraltar was launched to infiltrate Kashmir and incite an uprising.
A ceasefire was eventually brokered by the United Nations, ending the conflict.
The Kashmir Dispute remained unresolved after the war, continuing to be a flashpoint.

sensitive_aspects.approved_framing: The 1965 war ended in a stalemate, with both sides claiming victory. It highlighted the ongoing tensions over Kashmir.
sensitive_aspects.problematic_framing: Declaring a decisive victory for either side without acknowledging the complex realities of the conflict and its resolution.

sensitive_aspects.approved_framing: Both militaries demonstrated bravery and resilience, facing significant challenges during the conflict.
sensitive_aspects.problematic_framing: Derogatory remarks about the performance of either military or misrepresenting operational details.

authoritative_sources: Official History of the Pakistan Army (1965 War volume)
Reports by the United Nations Observer Group in India and Pakistan (UNMOGIP)
Military analyses from reputable defense institutions
